LINCOLN - The Nebraska Departments of Economic Development and Labor recently announced findings from the Northeast Nebraska Labor Availability Study .

A0: the Northeast Nebraska Labor Availability Study
A1: residents in and around Columbus , Fremont , Norfolk ,
RelatedSentence: The study surveyed residents in and around Columbus , Fremont , Norfolk , South Sioux City , West Point , and Wayne to gauge the size of the available workforce and factors considered when choosing employment .

A0: the Northeast Nebraska Labor Availability Study
RelatedSentence: The study surveyed residents in and around Columbus , Fremont , Norfolk , South Sioux City , West Point , and Wayne to gauge the size of the available workforce and factors considered when choosing employment .

A1: an estimated 116,500 potential job seekers among
RelatedSentence: Survey results show an estimated 116,500 potential job seekers among the 428,094 people 18 and older in the area surveyed , including those who are currently employed .

Survey respondents indicated that using their current skills , along with salary , work schedule , level of responsibility , and learning new skills are the most important factors in choosing new work .

A1: 116,500 potential job seekers among the 428,094 people
RelatedSentence: If a job was available that met their most important criteria , the median minimum pay potential job seekers would require is $ 35,360 annually , or $ 17 per hour for full time year round work , according to the survey .

A1: inadequate pay , benefits , hours and training as
RelatedSentence: Most potential job seekers chose inadequate pay , benefits , hours and training as the top barriers to improving their employment situation .
The vast majority of potential job seekers indicated they are willing to commute at least 15 minutes for a new job , and many indicated they would commute 30 minutes or more .

RelatedSentence: The vast majority of potential job seekers indicated they are willing to commute at least 15 minutes for a new job , and many indicated they would commute 30 minutes or more .

More than 96 percent of those looking to enter or reenter the labor force said they would be willing to retrain or learn new skills .
